articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Trump Selects Grenell for Global Diplomatic Roles
articles.description: Donald Trump, the U.S. President-elect, announced on his Truth Social platform that Richard Grenell, his former intelligence chief, will serve as his presidential envoy for special missions. Grenell is assigned to work in critical international locations like Venezuela and North Korea.
articles.content:
Donald Trump, the President-elect of the United States, has designated Richard Grenell, his former director of national intelligence, to serve as the presidential envoy for special missions.

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: From Drones to Daylight: Key Highlights in US Domestic News
articles.description: The latest US domestic news covers topics ranging from drone sightings in the Northeast, Trump’s call to end daylight saving time, to Nancy Pelosi undergoing surgery. Other highlights include a Texas AG lawsuit, ABC’s settlement with Trump’s library, and developments in commercial space launches and bird flu cases.
articles.content: In an unexpected turn of events, U.S. officials have revealed that most of the drone sightings reported in the Northeast actually involved manned aircraft, with no threat to national security detected. Meanwhile, President-elect Trump re-ignites the ... [741 chars]

articles.author: The Indian Express
articles.title: ABC News agrees to pay $15 million to Donald Trump in defamation suit
articles.description: The settlement agreement also states that ABC News and anchor George will issue public apologies saying they "regret statements" made about Trump during the interview conducted in March.
articles.content:
In 2023, Trump was convicted by a New York civil court of sexually abusing writer E. Jean Carroll, which is a different transgression from rape. (File Photo)

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: McConnell Warns Trump Nominees Against Vaccine Misinformation
articles.description: Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell warns Trump's health secretary nominee, Robert F. Kennedy Jr., against associating with vaccine misinformation. McConnell, a polio survivor, stresses the importance of vaccines, citing Kennedy's controversial stance on vaccines as concerning. Kennedy's moves could face resistance from a GOP-controlled Senate.
articles.content: Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell, a polio survivor, has urged President-elect Donald Trump's nominees to avoid any actions that could discredit the polio vaccine. McConnell's advice appears aimed at Robert F. Kennedy Jr., nominated as health ... [671 chars]

articles.description: Donald Trump previously was saved from an assassination attempt by Thomas Matthew Crooks during a rally in Butler, Pennsylvania, in June.

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: ABC Settles Trump Lawsuit with $15 Million for Library
articles.description: ABC News has agreed to a $15 million settlement over a lawsuit regarding anchor George Stephanopoulos' misstatement about Donald Trump in connection with the alleged rape of E. Jean Carroll. ABC will also cover legal fees and issue a public note of regret on its website.
articles.content: ABC News has reached a $15 million settlement, directed towards Donald Trump's presidential library, in a lawsuit generated by remarks made by anchor George Stephanopoulos. The lawsuit arose from Stephanopoulos' assertion that Trump was found civilly... [589 chars]

articles.title: Trump picks TruthSocial CEO Devin Nunes to lead intelligence advisory board
articles.description: President-elect Donald Trump on Saturday named Devin Nunes, the CEO of Trump’s TruthSocial platform, as chairman of the President’s Intelligence Advisory Board.

articles.title: Donald Trump Gets Big Win as ABC Apologizes, Agrees to Pay $15 million
articles.description: Trump filed his defamation suit after an ABC News anchor claimed that he had been "found liable for rape" in connection to writer E. Jean Carroll's lawsuits.
articles.content:
ABC News has agreed to pay $15 million toward Donald Trump's presidential library and issue a public apology to settle a defamation lawsuit over inaccurate statements made by anchor George Stephanopoulos during a broadcast earlier this year.

articles.title: ABC News and George Stephanopoulos agree to $15m payout in Trump case
articles.description: Network and anchor agree to settlement in defamation lawsuit Trump filed against network earlier this year
articles.content:
ABC News and anchor George Stephanopoulos agreed on Saturday to pay $15m to a foundation and museum to be established by Donald Trump as part of a settlement in the defamation lawsuit Trump filed against the network earlier this year.
